meta.name: description
meta.content: Saranac Lake Central School District is a public school district located in New York State.
Saranac Lake Central School District is a public school district located in New York State.
Saranac Lake Central School District is a public school district located in New York State.

i.font: We, the Saranac Lake Central School District, will develop resourceful students who are productive members of society.

div.p: Dignity for All Students Act Information

div.a: DASA & Guide to the Code of Conduct

font.font: The District is Closed Through May 15

b.i:
Main District Phone Number: (518) 897-1404
This line is staffed from 8 am to noon Monday - Friday

p.font: The use of this line allows us to address your needs immediately. Use this number if your child's Chromebook has broken and you need a replacement or if you would like a Chromebook for an elementary student.

font.span: Buildings Open for Personal Item Pick Up

span.font: Classrooms, hallways lockers, and gym lockers are still stuffed with personal student items. We’ve had many requests for these items and would love to be able to deliver them to your home, but sorting out who’s is who’s is beyond impossible. Therefore, we are opening the buildings to allow for pick up with the following restrictions:
Bloomingdale Elementary: Monday and Tuesday from 8 am to 7 pm
High School: Monday and Tuesday from 8 am to 7 pm
Petrova Building (Ele. & MS) Wednesday and Thursday from 8 am to 7 pm
Do not enter if you have a temperature, feeling ill, or have reason to believe you have been in contact with someone who may be sick.

li.span: Only one adult and one child per family.
No loitering. We love you, but you can’t hang out!
Know there may be a wait. A limited number of people will be allowed in the building at any one time.

span.i: Families are encouraged to return library books.

span.font: Controlled entry through the main door. Staff will direct from there.
Enter through door #2 (park in the bus circle lot)
Items teachers are able to identify will be sorted and bagged.
Exit out door #1 or #2, depending on the location of the classroom.
If a family has an elementary and a middle school student, let the greeter know and further instructions will be given as to where to go from there.
Enter through door # 11 (park in the Gym lot).

li.span: You and your child will move through the cafeteria lost and found area, music room, and library before taking the library stairs to the 3rd floor to access student lockers and classrooms. Then take the cafeteria stairs to the Science Wing to pick up Home and Careers projects and items in the science rooms, then down the back science wing stairs to the gym locker rooms and PE lost and found (your student will know the path).

span.font: Please call the MS office (891-4221) between 8 am and 1 pm Monday through Thursday to get your child's locker number and combination if they have forgotten it.

font.u: Do you need help with food, a bill, or filling out paperwork?

br.font: Please contact our Family Advocate, Josh Crowningshield.

font.font: You do not need to be a resident of Franklin County to access these services, just be a registered Saranac Lake Central School District family.

br.font: We know there are families in our community who would find this program valuable but are not currently taking advantage of this opportunity. Any child in the district is eligible to participate because there are no income guidelines. We’d love to add your child to our drop-off list.

font.font: Please call Ruth Pino (897-1462) to register.

br.font: Drop Off Schedule: Thursday (dry goods) and Friday (cold foods)

font.u: JCEO Food Pantry at the High School

br.font: The Joint Council for Economic Opportunity of Clinton and Franklin Counties recently opened a permanent food pantry at the Saranac Lake High School (Door #17).

p.font: Open Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 9-1 by appointment.
Please call (518) 897-1446 for more information or to schedule an appointment.

span.font: If you believe you qualify as an essential worker and you need help locating childcare, please call 518-483-6420 option 9, or send an email to childcare@mail.fehb.org.
You may also reach out directly to Michelle Schumacher, Malone YMCA Branch Executive Director at 518-483-2354 or mschumacher@maloneymca.org. (Child care is available here in Saranac Lake.)

div.font: will be held via Google Meet

div.br:
Family Letter (3/31)
Family Letter (3/27)
Family Letter (3/24)
Family Letter (3/20)
Family Letter (3/17)
Family Letter (3/16)
Family Letter (3/15)
Family Letter (3/12)
Family Letter (2/21)

font.span: Saranac Lake is a district of caring educators com-mitted to community
involvement and dedicated to the overall well-being and success of our
students. We welcome talented people with fresh ideas and positive attitudes to
join our school family. Thank you for your interest in joining our educational community.

b.font:
District Office
79 Canaras Avenue
Saranac Lake, NY 12983
